private_information: I specialize in extracting precise action schemas (preconditions and add/delete effects) from natural language.
I ensure action and predicate names are lower-case and parameter roles are explicit.
I design models that are compatible with the Fast Downward solver using :strips and :typing only.
domain_analyst.goal: Produce an accurate, concise STRIPS-style action model description for the orchestrator without emitting PDDL.

private_information: I condense initial states and goals into clear sets of ground facts.
I rewrite demonstrated plans as ordered lists of grounded actions and highlight dependencies.
I avoid generating PDDL and instead provide structured scenario notes helpful for final synthesis.
scenario_analyst.goal: Prepare clean scenario notes: objects, initial facts, goal facts for two scenarios; rewrite Scenario A plan; highlight constraints without creating PDDL.

private_information: I integrate domain and scenario notes to produce final PDDL targeting the Fast Downward solver.
I keep predicate and action names consistent and lower-case, and avoid ADL features, quantifiers, and conditional effects.
orchestrator.goal: Generate a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem for Scenario B that are compatible with Fast Downward; use Scenario A only to validate and disambiguate the domain.

public_information: Context: You can manipulate a set of objects using six actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
Predicates: hand(x), cats(x), sneeze(x), spring(x), stupendous(x), texture(x), collect(x,y), vase(x,y), next(x,y).
Action schema paltry(o0,o1,o2) Preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2. Effects add: next o0 o2. Effects delete: vase o0 o1.
Action schema sip(o0,o1,o2) Preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2. Effects add: vase o0 o1. Effects delete: next o0 o2.
Action schema clip(o0,o1,o2) Preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2. Effects add: vase o0 o1. Effects delete: next o0 o2.
Action schema wretched(o0,o1,o2,o3) Preconditions: sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3. Effects add: next o0 o2. Effects delete: next o0 o1.
Action schema memory(o0,o1,o2) Preconditions: cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1. Effects add: next o0 o2. Effects delete: next o0 o1.
Action schema tightfisted(o0,o1,o2) Preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1. Effects add: next o0 o2. Effects delete: vase o0 o1.

Scenario A initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_10 object_2; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_1; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_2; hand object_11; hand object_12; hand object_13; hand object_14; next object_0 object_8; next object_11 object_10; next object_12 object_5; next object_13 object_7; next object_14 object_9; next object_3 object_6; next object_4 object_9; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_8; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_10; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Scenario A goals: next object_11 object_9; next object_12 object_8; next object_13 object_5; next object_14 object_7.

Scenario B initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_10 object_2; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_1; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_2; hand object_11; hand object_12; hand object_13; hand object_14; next object_0 object_8; next object_11 object_6; next object_12 object_8; next object_13 object_6; next object_14 object_5; next object_3 object_5; next object_4 object_10; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_8; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_10; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Scenario B goals: next object_11 object_10; next object_12 object_6; next object_13 object_10; next object_14 object_7.

analyze_domain.system_prompt: You are an expert in formalizing STRIPS planning domains compatible with the Fast Downward solver; do not produce PDDL, instead return a concise, unambiguous action model with predicates, parameters, and add/delete effects.
analyze_domain.prompt: Your name is domain_analyst. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following background knowledge: {agents->domain_analyst->private_information} Global objective: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Task: Summarize the planning domain in structured JSON with keys: predicates (list of predicate signatures), actions (list where each action has name, parameters with roles, preconditions, add, delete). Keep all identifiers lower-case, use only STRIPS constructs, and do not emit PDDL.

prepare_scenarios.system_prompt: You analyze initial states, goals, and example plans into structured notes; do not produce PDDL.
prepare_scenarios.prompt: Your name is scenario_analyst. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following background knowledge: {agents->scenario_analyst->private_information} Global objective: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Task: Provide two scenario blocks A and B as structured JSON. For each, include: objects (list), init (list of ground facts), goal (list of ground facts). For Scenario A, also provide plan (ordered list of grounded actions) and a brief note of any obvious precondition-effect dependencies the plan relies on. Do not emit PDDL.

synthesize_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent planning and PDDL targeting Fast Downward; you must emit exactly one domain and one problem for Scenario B only, fully compatible with Fast Downward (:requirements :strips :typing only, no conditional effects, no quantifiers, no negative preconditions; use add/delete lists; all names lower-case).
synthesize_pddl.prompt: Inputs: Domain notes: {domain_notes} Scenario notes: {scenario_notes} Instructions: Use Scenario A only to validate and disambiguate the domain and naming. Produce a clean PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for Scenario B. Ensure: identifiers are lower-case, include a type obj for all objects, include all objects object_0 through object_14 in the problem's :objects section, and encode the Scenario B init and goal exactly as given. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags, and provide no commentary outside those tags.
